names.pinyin: gan cao gan jiang fu ling bai zhu tang
names.english: licorice, ginger, poria and white atractylodes decoction
names.commonEnglish: Licorice, Ginger, Poria, and White Atractylodes Decoction

actions: Warms the Middle, expels Cold, rescues Devastated Yang and expels Interior Cold.
With Bai Zhu, for diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency.
With Gan Cao, for epigastric pain and vomiting due to Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.
Wit Fu Ling, Gan Cao and Bai Zhu, for Cold-Dampness in the Lower Jiao leading to a sense of heaviness and Cold in the lower back.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, dries Dampness and promotes water metabolism.
With Gan Jiang, eliminates Cold Dampness in the Spleen with loss of taste, a sticky sensation in the mouth, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea and a thick, white tongue coat.
With Fu Ling and Gan Cao, for Spleen and Stomach Qi Deficiency.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness, strengthens the Spleen and harmonizes the Middle Jiao.
With Bai Zhu, strengthens the Spleen and resolves Dampness.

symptoms: Cold pain in the lower back and body
Extreme heavy sensation in the lower back

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with heaviness of the body and backache due to Damp-Heat.

modifications.purpose: older patients with chronic backache and urinary frequency and incontinence in children up to age fourteen
low back pain due to Cold-Damp
low back pain due to severe Cold-Damp
chronic low back pain due to severe Cold-Damp with Kidney Deficiency
low back pain due to Cold-Damp with severe heaviness in the low back
